brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability profile of ascending
      doses of GS010 in Leber Hereditary Optic Neuropathy (LHON) patients.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety Evaluation of Gene Therapy in Leber Hereditary Optic Neuropathy (LHON) Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Documented diagnosis of LHON based on a genetic test confirming the presence of the
        G11778A mutation in the mitochondrial ND4

        Age 18 years old or older at the time of study entry (informed consent signature)

        Visual acuity ≤ 1/10 of the less functional eye

        Exclusion Criteria:

        Any known allergy or hypersensibility to one of the product used during the trial

        Contraindication to IVT surgery (anaemia Hb <8g/dl, severe cardiovascular disease, severe
        coagulopathy…)

        Disorder of the ocular humors and of the internal retina involving visual disability

        Glaucoma

        Presence of other pathology whose symptoms or associated treatments might affect the
        retina or the optic nerve Vascular retinal occlusion

        Narrow angle contra-indicating pupillary dilation

        Other cause of optic neuropathy (inflammatory conditions or exposure to toxins...)

        Patients presenting known mutation of other genes implicated in pathological retinal
        conditions

clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label Dose Escalation Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and the Tolerability of GS010 (rAAV2/2-ND4) in Patients With Leber Hereditary Optic Neuropathy Due to Mutations in the Mitochondrial NADH Dehydrogenase 4 Gene

oversight_info.authority: France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of local and general adverse events and Serious Adverse Events

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label
